alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:07AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Franklin and southern St. Lawrence Counties through 200 AM EDT... At 107 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gouverneur, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40-45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gouverneur, Fowler, Carry Falls Reservoir, Degrasse, Madawaska, Russell, Fine, Stark, Edwards, Saranac Inn, Talcville, South Edwards, St. Regis Mountain, Fullerville, Childwold, Balmat, West Fowler and South Russell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence
